data.event: The first post office at this locale was established in 1887 and named Dorman after James W. Dorman, the first postmaster.
The name was changed to Dale in 1891.

event.title: was shown as being in Grant County by 1903

data.event: The office may have been moved south from its original location in Umatilla County and it was shown as being in Grant County by 1903.
Mail for Dale is now handled by the Ukiah post office, ZIP code 97880.

event.title: 1940, Dale had a service station and store that still serves

data.event: In 1940, Dale had a service station and store that still serves the community today.
Dale Ranger Station was open by 1911 and closed sometime before 2008.
